data.title: Oklahoma City Thunder Organizational Spotlight – Sports Philanthropy Network
data.text:
Thunder’s Annual Thanksgiving Dinner

A yearly Thanksgiving dinner orchestrated by the Thunder for members of the Boys and Girls Club of Oklahoma County. There are surprise appearances by OKC Thunder players, who partake in the various Thanksgiving-themed carnival games and activities. In 2020, this event was transformed into a drive-through event, where families were able to pick up boxes full of pre-prepared Thanksgiving dinners.

Thunder Day of Service

Annually Thunder players and staff come together and volunteer at a local pantry.

2020 – Helped pack diaper bags, organize clothes, label formula, and give other assistance to Infant Crisis Services

2019 – Spent the afternoon at the Regional Food Bank of Oklahoma to prepare food for distribution

Holiday Assist

Thunder players and staff take the time during the holidays to help the community celebrate at various events in the surrounding area. Last Christmas, the entire Thunder roster made a visit to 20 foster families from Citizens Caring for Children, an organization dedicated to providing the basic needs of children in foster care. Players came equipped with goodies for the children, and spent time playing in the arcade with those in attendance.
